meanings.definition: A thick oily substance used to lubricate machinery or make things slippery.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used grease to make the gears move smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The bike chain needed some grease to run quietly.
meanings.sent3: The slippery floor was like a grease-covered slide.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was so shiny, it looked like it had been coated in grease.
meanings.sent5: The grease on the hinges prevented them from squeaking.

meanings.definition: To smear or lubricate with grease.
meanings.sent1: He had to grease the wheels of the squeaky cart.
meanings.sent2: She decided to grease the pan before baking the cake.
meanings.sent3: The kids thought it would be funny to grease the doorknob.
meanings.sent4: The politician tried to grease the wheels of the new policy.
meanings.sent5: The athlete greased his body to slide faster on the ice.

meanings.sent1: She needed to grease the hinges of the door.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic will grease the engine to keep it running smoothly.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally greased his hands before shaking the boss's hand.
meanings.sent4: The chef will grease the baking pan before putting in the dough.
meanings.sent5: The farmer greased the gate to prevent it from rusting.
